intro: Tetraplasandra kavaiensis var. occidua, commonly known as the Kava kava variant, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is known for its aromatic properties. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
